duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and drive larger, more complex construction projects under general direction.
Manage overall program development effort, management plan, and progress monitoring.
Identify actions required in the event of deviation from the plan and adhere to standardized procedures and processes.
Represent company interests to exceed customer satisfaction and ensure overall safety program compliance.
Provide primary leadership for the program and associated Project Delivery Teams.
Collaborate with various teams to identify and deliver program objectives and establish project recovery plans.
Mentor project team and assess training needs for future project leaders.
Ensure accurate and timely reporting of assigned projects via operational and financial systems reporting.
Make presentations to Executive Management on current and forecasted performance and review overall subcontracting strategies.
Maintain relationships with major subcontractors and oversee monthly performance evaluations of strategic programs.
Responsible for overall scope management, coordination with installation managers, and program asset management.
Ensure project document controls are in compliance with contract requirements and seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Construction, Civil, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, Construction Management or Architecture. Master’s degree preferred. Certification as a PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) is highly preferred.
